reviewText:
Sherlock Holmes: the Definitive Collection, Vol IV

 There were fourteen movies that featured Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce as Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson. The first two, The Hound of the Baskervilles and The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes, were set in the late 19th century. The others were set in modern times and supported the Allied war effort. Each movie is on one DVD unlike some other collections. For more details read the individual reviews for each movie. The best movies are based on the original stories. One flaw is the use of Dr. Watson for comic relief, unlike the original stories.

Sherlock Holmes Faces Death (1943) tells about deaths at Musgrave Manor. Holmes finds a secret crypt with an old document, then solves the murders.

The House Of Fear (1945) tells of a club where the last survivor will benefit from the insurance policy on the others earlier deaths. Holmes solves the mystery.

Sherlock Holmes in Washington (1943) tells how Holmes is sent to retrieve a secret document that went missing when the courier disappeared. Will a German agent find this document?
